meanings: an official mark in your passport which allows you to enter or leave a particular country

meanings: when you visit a place or a person

meanings: the sounds that are made when people speak or sing
examples: She has a very loud/quiet/soft voice.
a clear/deep voice

Could you please keep your voices down?

meanings: the level of sound produced by a television, radio, etc.
examples: Could you turn the volume up/down, please.

meanings: when someone shows their choice or opinion in an election or meeting by writing a cross on an official piece of paper or putting their hand up
examples: He lost the election by twenty votes.

meanings: to show your choice or opinion in an election or meeting by writing a mark on an official piece of paper or by putting your hand up
examples: Who did you vote for?

meanings: a speech sound that you make with your lips and teeth open, shown in English by the letters a, e, i, o, or u
examples: A short vowel is a short sound as in the word 'cup'.
A long vowel is a long sound as in the word 'shoe'.

meanings: the amount of money a person regularly receives for their job
examples: weekly wages

a very low/high wage
the minimum wage
an hourly/daily/weekly wage

meanings: said in order to interrupt someone, or to get their attention or when you have suddenly thought of something important
examples: Wait a minute - I've just had an idea.

meanings: said in order to interrupt someone, or to get their attention or when you have suddenly thought of something important
examples: Now, wait a moment - I don't agree with that.

meanings: said in order to interrupt someone, or to get their attention or when you have suddenly thought of something important
examples: Now, wait a moment - I don't agree with that.

meanings: to stop sleeping or to make someone else stop sleeping
examples: Please wake me early tomorrow.

meanings: to walk with someone in order to guide them or keep them safe
examples: He walked me to my house.

meanings: to walk with a dog to give the dog exercise
examples: I walk the dog twice a day.

meanings: a long, thin piece of wood that you use when you are walking/playing hockey, etc.
examples: She uses a walking stick.

meanings: a large cupboard for keeping clothes in
examples: She was showing me her new built-in/fitted wardrobes.

meanings: friendly and loving
examples: They're a very warm family.

meanings: to make someone realise a possible danger or problem, especially one in the future
examples: We were warned not to eat the fish.

Put that ball down and come over here, Laura - I'm warning you!

meanings: something that tells or shows you that something bad may happen
examples: There's a warning on the cigarette packet that says 'Tobacco seriously damages health'.

meanings: to use too much of something or use something badly when there is a limited amount of it
examples: You waste a lot of water by having a bath instead of a shower.
Come on, let's get started - we've wasted enough time already.
Don't waste your money on me, love, keep it for yourself.

meanings: an unnecessary or wrong use of money, substances, time, energy, abilities, etc.
examples: That meeting achieved absolutely nothing - it was a complete waste of time.
She's been unemployed for two years and it's such a waste of her talents.
This food mixer's been a total waste of money - we never use it.

meanings: Waste material is no longer needed and can be got rid of.
examples: The Japanese recycle more than half of their waste paper.

meanings: water, especially from a river or stream, dropping from a higher to a lower point, sometimes from a great height
a line of higher water which moves across the surface of an area of water, especially the sea
when you raise your hand and move it from side to side in order to attract someone's attention or say goodbye
examples: At night, I listened to the sound of the waves breaking/crashing against the shore.
She gave a little wave as the train left.

meanings: to raise your hand and move it from side to side in order to attract someone's attention or to say goodbye
examples: I waved to/at him from the window but he didn't see me.
She was so annoyed she wouldn't even wave us goodbye/wave goodbye to us.

meanings: the direction in which something is facing or travels

meanings: used to refer to people generally

meanings: not physically strong

containing little taste or alcohol

meanings: to use something so much that it is damaged and cannot be used any more, or to become damaged in this way

meanings: a description of what the weather will be like
examples: Have you heard the weather forecast for tomorrow?

meanings: a type of net made by a spider to catch insects

meanings: a camera that records moving pictures and sounds and allows these to be shown on the Internet as they happen

meanings: a marriage ceremony and any celebrations such as a meal or a party that follow it

meanings: to have a heaviness of a stated amount, or to measure the heaviness of an object

meanings: the amount that something or someone weighs

meanings: when someone is met and spoken to in a friendly way when they arrive in a place

meanings: to greet someone who has arrived in a place

meanings: If you are welcome, people are pleased that you are there.

meanings: wearing attractive, good-quality clothes

meanings: in or from the west part of an area

examples: western Europe

meanings: describes paint, ink, or a similar substance when it has not had time to dry and become hard
examples: The paint's still wet.
a sign saying 'Wet paint!'

meanings: a very large sea mammal that breathes air through a hole at the top of its head
used to give your opinion, especially when you have strong feelings about something
examples: What rubbish!
What a mess!
What an awful day!

meanings: used to refer to something without naming it
examples: Do you know what I mean?

What I like most about her is her honesty.

I can't decide what to do next.

meanings: used to ask for someone's opinion on a particular subject

meanings: used to ask about something that could happen in the future, especially something bad

meanings: used to ask how things are with someone

meanings: anything or everything

meanings: a chair with wheels used by someone who cannot walk

meanings: used to talk about a choice between two or more possibilities

meanings: used to give extra information about something

meanings: Someone who is white has skin that is pale in colour.

examples: He had a black mother and a white father.

meanings: used to give more information about someone

meanings: used to ask who something belongs to or who someone or something is connected to

meanings: used to ask who something belongs to or who someone or something is connected to

meanings: used to talk about the reason for something

meanings: animals and plants that grow independently of people in their natural environment

meanings: to get the most votes in an election

meanings: a separate area on a computer screen showing information and which you can move around

meanings: the window at the front end of a car, bus, etc.

meanings: a sport in which you sail across water by standing on a board and holding onto a large sail

meanings: one of the body parts that a bird or insect uses to fly

meanings: to say that you hope someone will be lucky, successful, etc.

meanings: used to say what fills, covers, etc. something

meanings: before a particular period of time has finished

meanings: immediately

meanings: immediately

meanings: to exercise in order to improve the strength or appearance of your body

meanings: the people and things that are involved in a particular activity or subject

meanings: a problem that makes you feel anxious

meanings: comparative of badly

meanings: the most unpleasant or difficult thing, person, or situation

meanings: used to say what might happen if something else happens

meanings: used to show that you prefer to have or do one thing more than another

meanings: used to show that you prefer to have or do one thing more than another

meanings: used to request something politely

meanings: used to end a letter
